availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Ohio County Court Sct.

Jacob H. Leach one of the present Justices of the Peace for District No 8 of thiw County filed in Ohio Court his written Resignation of Said office to take effect from this day It is therefore ordered that Said office be declared vacant and that John J. Leach be and he is hereby recommended to his Excellency the Governor of this Commonwealth to fill Said vacancy.

A Copy --
Att. R. J. Moseley Clk O C C

Ohio Co
J.P. Dist No 8.
Appd Made Nov 15 1862
Please send Com: to Clk
